entities.name: hermione
entities.description: Hermione is mentioned as speaking crossly and taking the library's lack of information as a personal insult. She is described as someone who has never failed her before.

entities.name: library
entities.description: The library is mentioned as having a lack of useful information on the subject of Animagus.

entities.name: harry
entities.description: Harry is mentioned as resting his face-down on Saucy Tricks for Tricky Sorts and expressing regret over not learning to be an Animagus.

entities.name: ron
entities.description: Ron is mentioned as making a joke about Harry turning into a goldfish or frog.

entities.name: animagus
entities.description: An Animagus is described as a wizard who can transform into an animal.

entities.name: sirius
entities.description: Sirius is mentioned as someone Harry could have learned to be like.

entities.name: saucy tricks for tricky sorts
entities.description: Saucy Tricks for Tricky Sorts is mentioned as a book that Harry is resting his face-down on.

entities.name: goldfish
entities.description: Goldfish are mentioned as an example of what Harry could have turned into.

entities.name: frog
entities.description: Frogs are mentioned as another example of what Harry could have turned into.

relationships.description: Harry expresses regret over not learning to be an Animagus.
Ron makes a joke about Harry turning into a goldfish.
Harry jokes about turning into a frog.
Hermione is disappointed with the library's lack of useful information.
Harry expresses admiration for Sirius and wishes he could have learned to be like him.
